cards.flavor: Athreos cares little for the other gods' conflict with mortals. He is concerned only with safe passage for the dead.
cards.name: Aegis of the Gods
cards.text: You have hexproof. (You can't be the target of spells or abilities your opponents control.)

cards.name: Ajani's Presence
cards.text:
Strive — Ajani's Presence costs {2}{W} more to cast for each target beyond the first.
Any number of target creatures each get +1/+1 and gain indestructible until end of turn. (Damage and effects that say "destroy" don't destroy them.)

cards.flavor: Even when many of the soldiers who guarded Akros were called away, its safety was never in doubt.
cards.name: Akroan Mastiff
cards.text: {W}, {T}: Tap target creature.

cards.name: Armament of Nyx
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has double strike as long as it's an enchantment. Otherwise, prevent all damage that would be dealt by enchanted creature. (A creature with double strike deals both first-strike and regular combat damage.)

cards.name: Banishing Light
cards.text: When Banishing Light enters the battlefield, exile target nonland permanent an opponent controls until Banishing Light leaves the battlefield. (That permanent returns under its owner's control.)

cards.flavor: "Nyx may belong to the gods, but the skies of Theros are ours."
cards.name: Dawnbringer Charioteers
cards.text:
Flying, lifelink
Heroic — Whenever you cast a spell that targets Dawnbringer Charioteers, put a +1/+1 counter on Dawnbringer Charioteers.

cards.flavor:
"It is done."
—Elspeth
cards.name: Deicide
cards.text: Exile target enchantment. If the exiled card is a God card, search its controller's graveyard, hand, and library for any number of cards with the same name as that card and exile them, then that player shuffles his or her library.

cards.flavor:
"In our war Heliod gave mortals some favor, yet other times he withheld aid. Are we still no more than game pieces to him?"
—Polyxene the Doubter
cards.name: Dictate of Heliod
cards.text:
Flash
Creatures you control get +2/+2.

cards.flavor:
"Even from miles away, I could see our eagles circling. That's when I gave the command to pick up the pace. I knew we were needed at home."
—Kanlos, Akroan captain
cards.name: Eagle of the Watch
cards.text: Flying, vigilance

cards.flavor: It is the soul of a philosopher who died of starvation contemplating the universe.
cards.name: Eidolon of Rhetoric
cards.text: Each player can't cast more than one spell each turn.

cards.flavor: Drink deep, and be restored.
cards.name: Font of Vigor
cards.text: {2}{W}, Sacrifice Font of Vigor: You gain 7 life.

cards.name: Godsend
cards.text:
Equipped creature gets +3/+3.
Whenever equipped creature blocks or becomes blocked by one or more creatures, you may exile one of those creatures.
Opponents can't cast cards with the same name as cards exiled with Godsend.
Equip {3}

cards.flavor: Not all shields are forged of iron or bronze.
cards.name: Harvestguard Alseids
cards.text: Constellation — Whenever Harvestguard Alseids or another enchantment enters the battlefield under your control, prevent all damage that would be dealt to target creature this turn.

cards.flavor: Go forth with honor, return with glory.
cards.name: Lagonna-Band Trailblazer
cards.text: Heroic — Whenever you cast a spell that targets Lagonna-Band Trailblazer, put a +1/+1 counter on Lagonna-Band Trailblazer.

cards.name: Launch the Fleet
cards.text:
Strive — Launch the Fleet costs {1} more to cast for each target beyond the first.
Until end of turn, any number of target creatures each gain "Whenever this creature attacks, put a 1/1 white Soldier creature token onto the battlefield tapped and attacking."

cards.flavor: "The stars belong in the night sky. This is our world, and we are our own masters."
cards.name: Leonin Iconoclast
cards.text: Heroic — Whenever you cast a spell that targets Leonin Iconoclast, destroy target enchantment creature an opponent controls.

cards.name: Mortal Obstinacy
cards.text:
Enchant creature you control
Enchanted creature gets +1/+1.
Whenever enchanted creature deals combat damage to a player, you may sacrifice Mortal Obstinacy. If you do, destroy target enchantment.

cards.flavor: The gods are fascinated by innocence, perhaps because it's a quality they themselves lack.
cards.name: Nyx-Fleece Ram
cards.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, you gain 1 life.

cards.name: Oppressive Rays
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature can't attack or block unless its controller pays {3}.
Activated abilities of enchanted creature cost {3} more to activate.

cards.flavor:
After the Battle of Pharagax Bridge, the Champion spent many months among the leonin of Oreskos. She found that they were quick to take offense, not because they were thin-skinned, but because they were always eager for a fight.
—The Theriad
cards.name: Oreskos Swiftclaw
Phalanx Formation
cards.text:
Strive — Phalanx Formation costs {1}{W} more to cast for each target beyond the first.
Any number of target creatures each gain double strike until end of turn. (They deal both first-strike and regular combat damage.)

cards.name: Quarry Colossus
cards.text: When Quarry Colossus enters the battlefield, put target creature into its owner's library just beneath the top X cards of that library, where X is the number of Plains you control.

cards.flavor:
"A tiny flame is enough to dispel the night."
—Elspeth
cards.name: Reprisal
cards.text: Destroy target creature with power 4 or greater. It can't be regenerated.

cards.name: Sightless Brawler
cards.text:
Bestow {4}{W} (If you cast this card for its bestow cost, it's an Aura spell with enchant creature. It becomes a creature again if it's not attached to a creature.)
Sightless Brawler can't attack alone.
Enchanted creature gets +3/+2 and can't attack alone.

cards.name: Skybind
cards.text: Constellation — Whenever Skybind or another enchantment enters the battlefield under your control, exile target nonenchantment permanent. Return that card to the battlefield under its owner's control at the beginning of the next end step.

cards.flavor: Pray her spear reaches you first. Her griffin is less kind.
cards.name: Skyspear Cavalry
cards.text:
Flying
Double strike (This creature deals both first-strike and regular combat damage.)

cards.flavor: Ephara taught some mortals to feel every vein in marble as though it flows with their own blood.
cards.name: Stonewise Fortifier
cards.text: {4}{W}: Prevent all damage that would be dealt to Stonewise Fortifier by target creature this turn.

cards.flavor: They are trained from hatching to deliver aid where it is needed most.
cards.name: Supply-Line Cranes
cards.text:
Flying
When Supply-Line Cranes enters the battlefield, put a +1/+1 counter on target creature.

cards.flavor: "Death is tyranny. Like all tyranny, it must be opposed."
cards.name: Tethmos High Priest
cards.text: Heroic — Whenever you cast a spell that targets Tethmos High Priest, return target creature card with converted mana cost 2 or less from your graveyard to the battlefield.

cards.name: Aerial Formation
cards.text:
Strive — Aerial Formation costs {2}{U} more to cast for each target beyond the first.
Any number of target creatures each get +1/+1 and gain flying until end of turn.

cards.name: Battlefield Thaumaturge
cards.text:
Each instant and sorcery spell you cast costs {1} less to cast for each creature it targets.
Heroic — Whenever you cast a spell that targets Battlefield Thaumaturge, Battlefield Thaumaturge gains hexproof until end of turn.

cards.flavor:
"That is not the voice of the wind singing on the stones."
—Callaphe the mariner
cards.name: Cloaked Siren
cards.text:
Flash (You may cast this spell any time you could cast an instant.)
Flying

cards.flavor: The physical pain was nothing compared to the agony in his mind.
cards.name: Countermand
cards.text: Counter target spell. Its controller puts the top four cards of his or her library into his or her graveyard.

cards.name: Crystalline Nautilus
cards.text:
Bestow {3}{U}{U} (If you cast this card for its bestow cost, it's an Aura spell with enchant creature. It becomes a creature again if it's not attached to a creature.)
When Crystalline Nautilus becomes the target of a spell or ability, sacrifice it.
Enchanted creature gets +4/+4 and has "When this creature becomes the target of a spell or ability, sacrifice it."

cards.flavor: Choices are rarely as simple as they seem.
cards.name: Dakra Mystic
cards.text: {U}, {T}: Each player reveals the top card of his or her library. You may put the revealed cards into their owners' graveyards. If you don't, each player draws a card.

cards.flavor: Honesty is the first casualty of war.
cards.name: Daring Thief
cards.text: Inspired — Whenever Daring Thief becomes untapped, you may exchange control of target nonland permanent you control and target permanent an opponent controls that shares a card type with it.

cards.flavor: "Knowledge is cruel. It will break your heart and test your allegiances. Are you certain you want this curse?"
cards.name: Dictate of Kruphix
cards.text:
Flash
At the beginning of each player's draw step, that player draws an additional card.

cards.flavor: Drink deep, and your thoughts will flow freely.
cards.name: Font of Fortunes
cards.text: {1}{U}, Sacrifice Font of Fortunes: Draw two cards.

cards.flavor:
"I will match Thassa drop for drop and show a god what true power is."
—Kiora
cards.name: Godhunter Octopus
cards.text: Godhunter Octopus can't attack unless defending player controls an enchantment or an enchanted permanent.

cards.name: Hour of Need
cards.text:
Strive — Hour of Need costs {1}{U} more to cast for each target beyond the first.
Exile any number of target creatures. For each creature exiled this way, its controller puts a 4/4 blue Sphinx creature token with flying onto the battlefield.

cards.flavor:
"You wish to learn of Nyx? Very well."
—Phenax, god of deception
cards.name: Hubris
cards.text: Return target creature and all Auras attached to it to their owners' hands.

cards.name: Hypnotic Siren
cards.text:
Bestow {5}{U}{U} (If you cast this card for its bestow cost, it's an Aura spell with enchant creature. It becomes a creature again if it's not attached to a creature.)
Flying
You control enchanted creature.
Enchanted creature gets +1/+1 and has flying.

cards.name: Interpret the Signs
cards.text: Scry 3, then reveal the top card of your library. Draw cards equal to that card's converted mana cost. (To scry 3, look at the top three cards of your library, then put any number of them on the bottom of your library and the rest on top in any order.)

cards.name: Kiora's Dismissal
cards.text:
Strive — Kiora's Dismissal costs {U} more to cast for each target beyond the first.
Return any number of target enchantments to their owners' hands.

cards.flavor:
"Mortal strength, like mortal hope, is so easily crushed."
—Thassa, god of the sea
cards.name: Pin to the Earth
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets -6/-0.

cards.name: Polymorphous Rush
cards.text:
Strive — Polymorphous Rush costs {1}{U} more to cast for each target beyond the first.
Choose a creature on the battlefield. Any number of target creatures you control each become a copy of that creature until end of turn.

cards.flavor: Ideas, not stones, form the true foundation of Meletis.
cards.name: Pull from the Deep
cards.text: Return up to one target instant card and up to one target sorcery card from your graveyard to your hand. Exile Pull from the Deep.

cards.flavor:
"I want one."
—Kiora
cards.name: Riptide Chimera
cards.text:
Flying
At the beginning of your upkeep, return an enchantment you control to its owner's hand.

cards.flavor: An offering to the sea brings an insight from the stars.
cards.name: Rise of Eagles
cards.text: Put two 2/2 blue Bird enchantment creature tokens with flying onto the battlefield. Scry 1. (Look at the top card of your library. You may put that card on the bottom of your library.)

cards.name: Sage of Hours
cards.text:
Heroic — Whenever you cast a spell that targets Sage of Hours, put a +1/+1 counter on it.
Remove all +1/+1 counters from Sage of Hours: For each five counters removed this way, take an extra turn after this one.

cards.name: Scourge of Fleets
cards.text: When Scourge of Fleets enters the battlefield, return each creature your opponents control with toughness X or less to its owner's hand, where X is the number of Islands you control.

cards.flavor: Kruphix hid the most dire prophecies about humankind where humans would never find them and tritons wouldn't care to read them.
cards.name: Sigiled Starfish
cards.text: {T}: Scry 1. (Look at the top card of your library. You may put that card on the bottom of your library.)

cards.flavor: When mortals claim there are places Thassa cannot reach, the sea god laughs.
cards.name: Thassa's Devourer
cards.text: Constellation — Whenever Thassa's Devourer or another enchantment enters the battlefield under your control, target player puts the top two cards of his or her library into his or her graveyard.

cards.flavor: The sailor had never seen a god before. Now she had gazed upon Thassa. Shortly she would see Athreos, and then she would meet Erebos.
cards.name: Thassa's Ire
cards.text: {3}{U}: You may tap or untap target creature.

cards.flavor: The tritons broke the surface, and the Nyxborn broke ranks.
cards.name: Triton Cavalry
cards.text: Heroic — Whenever you cast a spell that targets Triton Cavalry, you may return target enchantment to its owner's hand.

cards.flavor: "Who will miss you, drywalker? A wife? A child? Perhaps they will blame the sea for your fate, and teach future generations to stay far away from it."
cards.name: Triton Shorestalker
cards.text: Triton Shorestalker can't be blocked.

cards.flavor: Once she sang sailors to their doom. Now she leads them to glory.
cards.name: War-Wing Siren
cards.text:
Flying
Heroic — Whenever you cast a spell that targets War-Wing Siren, put a +1/+1 counter on War-Wing Siren.

cards.flavor: Stand against the crash of the river's rapids and you will know the power of the naiads.
cards.name: Whitewater Naiads
cards.text: Constellation — Whenever Whitewater Naiads or another enchantment enters the battlefield under your control, target creature can't be blocked this turn.

cards.flavor: Erebos's minions hunt the Returned and warn those who consider the same folly.
cards.name: Agent of Erebos
cards.text: Constellation — Whenever Agent of Erebos or another enchantment enters the battlefield under your control, exile all cards from target player's graveyard.

cards.flavor:
"My adopted children are loved no less."
—Pharika, god of affliction
cards.name: Aspect of Gorgon
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +1/+3 and has deathtouch. (Any amount of damage it deals to a creature is enough to destroy it.)

cards.name: Bloodcrazed Hoplite
cards.text:
Heroic — Whenever you cast a spell that targets Bloodcrazed Hoplite, put a +1/+1 counter on it.
Whenever a +1/+1 counter is placed on Bloodcrazed Hoplite, remove a +1/+1 counter from target creature an opponent controls.

cards.name: Brain Maggot
cards.text: When Brain Maggot enters the battlefield, target opponent reveals his or her hand and you choose a nonland card from it. Exile that card until Brain Maggot leaves the battlefield.

cards.flavor: In desperation the soldier prayed to Phenax, begging for the power to cheat the gorgon's gaze.
cards.name: Cast into Darkness
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets -2/-0 and can't block.

cards.name: Cruel Feeding
cards.text:
Strive — Cruel Feeding costs {2}{B} more to cast for each target beyond the first.
Any number of target creatures each get +1/+0 and gain lifelink until end of turn. (Damage dealt by a creature with lifelink also causes its controller to gain that much life.)

cards.flavor: "I take no pleasure in your suffering, but it is necessary. Once you accept your fate you'll find eternity more tolerable."
cards.name: Dictate of Erebos
cards.text:
Flash
Whenever a creature you control dies, each opponent sacrifices a creature.

cards.flavor: Crippling fear precedes it. A foul stench accompanies it. Death follows in its wake.
cards.name: Doomwake Giant
cards.text: Constellation — Whenever Doomwake Giant or another enchantment enters the battlefield under your control, creatures your opponents control get -1/-1 until end of turn.

cards.name: Dreadbringer Lampads
cards.text: Constellation — Whenever Dreadbringer Lampads or another enchantment enters the battlefield under your control, target creature gains intimidate until end of turn. (It can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or creatures that share a color with it.)

cards.flavor: Phenax offers the hope of life, while Pharika grants the solace of death. Between them stands Erebos, who promises nothing but eternity.
cards.name: Extinguish All Hope
cards.text: Destroy all nonenchantment creatures.

cards.flavor: "We gave the gods the power to war against us. It is time we took that power back."
cards.name: Feast of Dreams
cards.text: Destroy target enchanted creature or enchantment creature.

cards.flavor: It's common practice among minotaurs to collect the heads of their victims as trophies. Sometimes the trophies prove more than ornamental.
cards.name: Felhide Petrifier
cards.text:
Deathtouch
Other Minotaur creatures you control have deathtouch.

cards.flavor: Drink deep, and death will recoil from you.
cards.name: Font of Return
cards.text: {3}{B}, Sacrifice Font of Return: Return up to three target creature cards from your graveyard to your hand.

cards.name: Gnarled Scarhide
cards.text:
Bestow {3}{B} (If you cast this card for its bestow cost, it's an Aura spell with enchant creature. It becomes a creature again if it's not attached to a creature.)
Gnarled Scarhide can't block.
Enchanted creature gets +2/+1 and can't block.

cards.flavor: Occasionally the living wander to the Rivers, but the wardens of Athreos ensure that only the dead pass.
cards.name: Grim Guardian
cards.text: Constellation — Whenever Grim Guardian or another enchantment enters the battlefield under your control, each opponent loses 1 life.

cards.name: King Macar, the Gold-Cursed
cards.text: Inspired — Whenever King Macar, the Gold-Cursed becomes untapped, you may exile target creature. If you do, put a colorless artifact token named Gold onto the battlefield. It has "Sacrifice this artifact: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool."

cards.flavor: Any pleasure, when taken to excess, becomes torment. It's a formula that demons have perfected.
cards.name: Master of the Feast
cards.text:
Flying
At the beginning of your upkeep, each opponent draws a card.

cards.flavor:
"To think some believe it peaceful to die in one's sleep."
—Ashiok, Nightmare Weaver
cards.name: Nightmarish End
cards.text: Target creature gets -X/-X until end of turn, where X is the number of cards in your hand.

cards.flavor: A balm or a poison depending on how it is administered, and to whom.
cards.name: Nyx Infusion
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +2/+2 as long as it's an enchantment. Otherwise, it gets -2/-2.

cards.flavor: The serpents' dens built into statues of Pharika serve not only to consecrate her temples, but as a hidden line of defense.
cards.name: Pharika's Chosen
cards.text: Deathtouch (Any amount of damage this deals to a creature is enough to destroy it.)

cards.flavor: The flesh is dead and the life forgotten, but old habits persist.
cards.name: Returned Reveler
cards.text: When Returned Reveler dies, each player puts the top three cards of his or her library into his or her graveyard.

cards.flavor: A mask forged to avenge a death forgotten.
cards.name: Ritual of the Returned
cards.text: Exile target creature card from your graveyard. Put a black Zombie creature token onto the battlefield. Its power is equal to that card's power and its toughness is equal to that card's toughness.

cards.flavor:
The hulk rose from the sea and loomed over the Champion. Pinned beneath the twisting, rotted planks of wood was the body of Kaliaros, the helmsman of her former crew, and beside him the captain, Photine.
—The Theriad
cards.name: Rotted Hulk
Silence the Believers
cards.text:
Strive — Silence the Believers costs {2}{B} more to cast for each target beyond the first.
Exile any number of target creatures and all Auras attached to them.

cards.flavor:
"Only a fool takes Phenax at his word. What do you expect from a god born of lies and betrayal?"
—Verenes, priest of Iroas
cards.name: Spiteful Blow
cards.text: Destroy target creature and target land.

cards.flavor: Leeches are sacred to followers of Pharika for drawing poison from a wound, but feared by everyone else for drawing blood from the flesh.
cards.name: Squelching Leeches
cards.text: Squelching Leeches's power and toughness are each equal to the number of Swamps you control.

cards.flavor: Some predators can sense fear in their prey, but the lamia is drawn to madness.
cards.name: Thoughtrender Lamia
cards.text: Constellation — Whenever Thoughtrender Lamia or another enchantment enters the battlefield under your control, each opponent discards a card.

cards.flavor:
"Not all nightmares can be escaped by waking."
—Ashiok, Nightmare Weaver
cards.name: Tormented Thoughts
cards.text:
As an additional cost to cast Tormented Thoughts, sacrifice a creature.
Target player discards a number of cards equal to the sacrificed creature's power.

cards.flavor: Elspeth feared that her trespass into Nyx would not go unanswered.
cards.name: Worst Fears
cards.text: You control target player during that player's next turn. Exile Worst Fears. (You see all cards that player could see and make all decisions for the player.)

cards.flavor: The enemies' shields are the first to shatter, and their battle line is never far behind.
cards.name: Akroan Line Breaker
cards.text: Heroic — Whenever you cast a spell that targets Akroan Line Breaker, Akroan Line Breaker gets +2/+0 and gains intimidate until end of turn. (It can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or creatures that share a color with it.)

cards.flavor: To hold the heavens from the earth is no curse, but a titanic responsibility.
cards.name: Bearer of the Heavens
cards.text: When Bearer of the Heavens dies, destroy all permanents at the beginning of the next end step.

cards.flavor: Deathbellow Canyon is home to minotaurs and many other creatures that share a love for the taste of human flesh.
cards.name: Bladetusk Boar
cards.text: Intimidate (This creature can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or creatures that share a color with it.)

cards.name: Blinding Flare
cards.text:
Strive — Blinding Flare costs {R} more to cast for each target beyond the first.
Any number of target creatures can't block this turn.

cards.flavor:
"The anger that festers inside this one is contagious."
—Anthousa of Setessa
cards.name: Cyclops of Eternal Fury
cards.text: Creatures you control have haste.

cards.flavor: Iroas and Mogis are as different in appearance as they are in personality.
cards.name: Dictate of the Twin Gods
cards.text:
Flash
If a source would deal damage to a permanent or player, it deals double that damage to that permanent or player instead.

cards.flavor: Xenagos reveled while Theros burned.
cards.name: Eidolon of the Great Revel
cards.text: Whenever a player casts a spell with converted mana cost 3 or less, Eidolon of the Great Revel deals 2 damage to that player.

cards.name: Flamespeaker's Will
cards.text:
Enchant creature you control
Enchanted creature gets +1/+1.
Whenever enchanted creature deals combat damage to a player, you may sacrifice Flamespeaker's Will. If you do, destroy target artifact.

cards.flavor: A minotaur does not distinguish between human, satyr, and triton. They are all meat.
cards.name: Flurry of Horns
cards.text: Put two 2/3 red Minotaur creature tokens with haste onto the battlefield.

cards.flavor: Drink deep, and find your vengeance fulfilled.
cards.name: Font of Ire
cards.text: {3}{R}, Sacrifice Font of Ire: Font of Ire deals 5 damage to target player.

cards.flavor: Purphoros shaped the oreads out of stray coals from his forge.
cards.name: Forgeborn Oreads
cards.text: Constellation — Whenever Forgeborn Oreads or another enchantment enters the battlefield under your control, Forgeborn Oreads deals 1 damage to target creature or player.

cards.flavor: The cyclops had learned to never eat a shepherd. Instead he gently flung the "pit" aside to grow a new flock.
cards.name: Gluttonous Cyclops
cards.text: {5}{R}{R}: Monstrosity 3. (If this creature isn't monstrous, put three +1/+1 counters on it and it becomes monstrous.)

cards.name: Harness by Force
cards.text:
Strive — Harness by Force costs {2}{R} more to cast for each target beyond the first.
Gain control of any number of target creatures until end of turn. Untap those creatures. They gain haste until end of turn.

cards.flavor:
"Information is a powerful weapon."
—Cymede, queen of Akros
cards.name: Knowledge and Power
cards.text: Whenever you scry, you may pay {2}. If you do, Knowledge and Power deals 2 damage to target creature or player.

cards.flavor: "I fight for Keranos and for mortals. I see no contradiction."
cards.name: Lightning Diadem
cards.text:
Enchant creature
When Lightning Diadem enters the battlefield, it deals 2 damage to target creature or player.
Enchanted creature gets +2/+2.

cards.flavor: The ancient dragon Thraxes sleeps in Purphoros's sacred peak. When he stirs in dreams, so does the mountain.
cards.name: Magma Spray
cards.text: Magma Spray deals 2 damage to target creature. If that creature would die this turn, exile it instead.

cards.name: Mogis's Warhound
cards.text:
Bestow {2}{R} (If you cast this card for its bestow cost, it's an Aura spell with enchant creature. It becomes a creature again if it's not attached to a creature.)
Mogis's Warhound attacks each turn if able.
Enchanted creature gets +2/+2 and attacks each turn if able.

cards.flavor:
The Champion and her companions marched through the night, but the battle was over before they arrived. In the middle of the carnage sat a solitary minotaur, lost in what seemed to the Champion to be thought.
—The Theriad
cards.name: Pensive Minotaur

cards.flavor: Fire to destroy. Fire to create.
cards.name: Prophetic Flamespeaker
cards.text:
Double strike, trample
Whenever Prophetic Flamespeaker deals combat damage to a player, exile the top card of your library. You may play it this turn.

cards.name: Riddle of Lightning
cards.text: Choose target creature or player. Scry 3, then reveal the top card of your library. Riddle of Lightning deals damage equal to that card's converted mana cost to that creature or player. (To scry 3, look at the top three cards of your library, then put any number of them on the bottom of your library and the rest on top in any order.)

cards.flavor:
"Embrace every moment, for it could be your last."
—Xenagos, god of revels
cards.name: Rollick of Abandon
cards.text: All creatures get +2/-2 until end of turn.

cards.name: Rouse the Mob
cards.text:
Strive — Rouse the Mob costs {2}{R} more to cast for each target beyond the first.
Any number of target creatures each get +2/+0 and gain trample until end of turn.

cards.flavor: "Xenagos has become what he once despised: a tyrant and an oppressor."
cards.name: Satyr Hoplite
cards.text: Heroic — Whenever you cast a spell that targets Satyr Hoplite, put a +1/+1 counter on Satyr Hoplite.

cards.flavor: The runes seem to come alive as it moves, rippling like slow flames across its scales.
cards.name: Sigiled Skink
cards.text: Whenever Sigiled Skink attacks, scry 1. (Look at the top card of your library. You may put that card on the bottom of your library.)

cards.flavor: Sparks from Purphoros's forge fill the belly of every dragon.
cards.name: Spawn of Thraxes
cards.text:
Flying
When Spawn of Thraxes enters the battlefield, it deals damage to target creature or player equal to the number of Mountains you control.

cards.name: Spite of Mogis
cards.text: Spite of Mogis deals damage to target creature equal to the number of instant and sorcery cards in your graveyard. Scry 1. (Look at the top card of your library. You may put that card on the bottom of your library.)

cards.flavor:
"The most brilliant stars are not born of Nyx."
—Rhexenor, Akroan flamespeaker
cards.name: Starfall
cards.text: Starfall deals 3 damage to target creature. If that creature is an enchantment, Starfall deals 3 damage to that creature's controller.

cards.name: Twinflame
cards.text:
Strive — Twinflame costs {2}{R} more to cast for each target beyond the first.
Choose any number of target creatures you control. For each of them, put a token that's a copy of that creature onto the battlefield. Those tokens have haste. Exile them at the beginning of the next end step.

cards.name: Wildfire Cerberus
cards.text:
{5}{R}{R}: Monstrosity 1. (If this creature isn't monstrous, put a +1/+1 counter on it and it becomes monstrous.)
When Wildfire Cerberus becomes monstrous, it deals 2 damage to each opponent and each creature your opponents control.

cards.flavor: Setessan warriors of Bassara Tower are known for their guerrilla tactics and skill with the bow. Interlopers into the Nessian Wood do not get far.
cards.name: Bassara Tower Archer
cards.text: Hexproof, reach

cards.name: Colossal Heroics
cards.text:
Strive — Colossal Heroics costs {1}{G} more to cast for each target beyond the first.
Any number of target creatures each get +2/+2 until end of turn. Untap those creatures.

cards.name: Consign to Dust
cards.text:
Strive — Consign to Dust costs {2}{G} more to cast for each target beyond the first.
Destroy any number of target artifacts and/or enchantments.

cards.flavor:
"The gods think of us as insects. Perhaps there is wisdom in that."
—Perisophia the philosopher
cards.name: Desecration Plague
cards.text: Destroy target enchantment or land.

cards.flavor: "I refuse to let the folly of mortals endanger the home I made for them."
cards.name: Dictate of Karametra
cards.text:
Flash
Whenever a player taps a land for mana, that player adds one mana to his or her mana pool of any type that land produced.

cards.flavor: The emotional echoes of dryad gatherings attract lost souls.
cards.name: Eidolon of Blossoms
cards.text: Constellation — Whenever Eidolon of Blossoms or another enchantment enters the battlefield under your control, draw a card.

cards.flavor: Drink deep, and know the path to the heart of the wilds.
cards.name: Font of Fertility
cards.text: {1}{G}, Sacrifice Font of Fertility: Search your library for a basic land card, put it onto the battlefield tapped, then shuffle your library.

cards.flavor:
"It is not yours to hunt, mortal. Be content with its beauty alone."
—Nylea, god of the hunt
cards.name: Golden Hind
cards.text: {T}: Add {G} to your mana pool.

cards.flavor: The temptation to take the ox's golden hide is as irresistible as it is fatal.
cards.name: Goldenhide Ox
cards.text: Constellation — Whenever Goldenhide Ox or another enchantment enters the battlefield under your control, target creature must be blocked this turn if able.

cards.flavor: Travelers' tales claim that hydras bite off their own heads to make themselves deadlier.
cards.name: Heroes' Bane
cards.text:
Heroes' Bane enters the battlefield with four +1/+1 counters on it.
{2}{G}{G}: Put X +1/+1 counters on Heroes' Bane, where X is its power.

cards.flavor: The anger of the gods multiplied in Nyx, and the land awoke in dark echoes of their rage.
cards.name: Humbler of Mortals
cards.text: Constellation — Whenever Humbler of Mortals or another enchantment enters the battlefield under your control, creatures you control gain trample until end of turn.

cards.name: Hydra Broodmaster
cards.text:
{X}{X}{G}: Monstrosity X. (If this creature isn't monstrous, put X +1/+1 counters on it and it becomes monstrous.)
When Hydra Broodmaster becomes monstrous, put X X/X green Hydra creature tokens onto the battlefield.

cards.flavor: The horizon is tantalizing in both its uncertainty and its potential.
cards.name: Kruphix's Insight
cards.text: Reveal the top six cards of your library. Put up to three enchantment cards from among them into your hand and the rest of the revealed cards into your graveyard.

cards.flavor: Commerce is always the basis for peace.
cards.name: Market Festival
cards.text:
Enchant land
Whenever enchanted land is tapped for mana, its controller adds two mana in any combination of colors to his or her mana pool (in addition to the mana the land produces).

cards.flavor: Nature protects its own.
cards.name: Nature's Panoply
cards.text:
Strive — Nature's Panoply costs {2}{G} more to cast for each target beyond the first.
Choose any number of target creatures. Put a +1/+1 counter on each of them.

cards.name: Nessian Game Warden
cards.text: When Nessian Game Warden enters the battlefield, look at the top X cards of your library, where X is the number of Forests you control. You may reveal a creature card from among them and put it into your hand. Put the rest on the bottom of your library in any order.

cards.flavor:
"I do not know if the forest was different after they passed. But I know I was."
—Ianthe, Setessan hunter
cards.name: Oakheart Dryads
cards.text: Constellation — Whenever Oakheart Dryads or another enchantment enters the battlefield under your control, target creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.

cards.flavor: "Flesh and bone or star and shadow. It makes no difference to my club."
cards.name: Pheres-Band Thunderhoof
cards.text: Heroic — Whenever you cast a spell that targets Pheres-Band Thunderhoof, put two +1/+1 counters on Pheres-Band Thunderhoof.

cards.flavor: The renowned warchiefs of Pheres Band fight with the might of minotaurs and the sagacity of sphinxes.
cards.name: Pheres-Band Warchief
cards.text:
Vigilance, trample
Other Centaur creatures you control get +1/+1 and have vigilance and trample.

cards.flavor: Hunger makes a leucrocota dangerous. A full belly makes it angry and dangerous.
cards.name: Ravenous Leucrocota
cards.text:
Vigilance
{6}{G}: Monstrosity 3. (If this creature isn't monstrous, put three +1/+1 counters on it and it becomes monstrous.)

cards.flavor: "You think your weaving as beautiful as mine? Let me show you the true meaning of the craft."
cards.name: Renowned Weaver
cards.text: {1}{G}, Sacrifice Renowned Weaver: Put a 1/3 green Spider enchantment creature token with reach onto the battlefield. (It can block creatures with flying.)

cards.flavor: "Listen to my song, and you need never forge a golden mask to return to me."
cards.name: Reviving Melody
cards.text:
Choose one or both —
• Return target creature card from your graveyard to your hand.
• Return target enchantment card from your graveyard to your hand.

cards.flavor: "Some of my kin dance for themselves, without greater purpose. Nylea gives me purpose, and with it strength."
cards.name: Satyr Grovedancer
cards.text: When Satyr Grovedancer enters the battlefield, put a +1/+1 counter on target creature.

cards.name: Setessan Tactics
cards.text:
Strive — Setessan Tactics costs {G} more to cast for each target beyond the first.
Until end of turn, any number of target creatures each get +1/+1 and gain "{T}: This creature fights another target creature."

cards.name: Solidarity of Heroes
cards.text:
Strive — Solidarity of Heroes costs {1}{G} more to cast for each target beyond the first.
Choose any number of target creatures. Double the number of +1/+1 counters on each of them.

cards.name: Spirespine
cards.text:
Bestow {4}{G} (If you cast this card for its bestow cost, it's an Aura spell with enchant creature. It becomes a creature again if it's not attached to a creature.)
Spirespine blocks each turn if able.
Enchanted creature gets +4/+1 and blocks each turn if able.

cards.name: Strength from the Fallen
cards.text: Constellation — Whenever Strength from the Fallen or another enchantment enters the battlefield under your control, target creature gets +X/+X until end of turn, where X is the number of creature cards in your graveyard.

cards.name: Swarmborn Giant
cards.text:
When you're dealt combat damage, sacrifice Swarmborn Giant.
{4}{G}{G}: Monstrosity 2. (If this creature isn't monstrous, put two +1/+1 counters on it and it becomes monstrous.)
As long as Swarmborn Giant is monstrous, it has reach.

cards.name: Ajani, Mentor of Heroes
cards.text:
+1: Distribute three +1/+1 counters among one, two, or three target creatures you control.
+1: Look at the top four cards of your library. You may reveal an Aura, creature, or planeswalker card from among them and put it into your hand. Put the rest on the bottom of your library in any order.
−8: You gain 100 life.

cards.name: Athreos, God of Passage
cards.text:
Indestructible
As long as your devotion to white and black is less than seven, Athreos isn't a creature.
Whenever another creature you own dies, return it to your hand unless target opponent pays 3 life.

cards.flavor: At the Akroan gates, hoplites revived the tactics of Kytheon Iora's infamous irregulars.
cards.name: Desperate Stand
cards.text:
Strive — Desperate Stand costs {R}{W} more to cast for each target beyond the first.
Any number of target creatures each get +2/+0 and gain first strike and vigilance until end of turn.

cards.name: Disciple of Deceit
cards.text: Inspired — Whenever Disciple of Deceit becomes untapped, you may discard a nonland card. If you do, search your library for a card with the same converted mana cost as that card, reveal it, put it into your hand, then shuffle your library.

cards.name: Fleetfeather Cockatrice
cards.text:
Flash (You may cast this spell any time you could cast an instant.)
Flying, deathtouch
{5}{G}{U}: Monstrosity 3. (If this creature isn't monstrous, put three +1/+1 counters on it and it becomes monstrous.)

cards.name: Iroas, God of Victory
cards.text:
Indestructible
As long as your devotion to red and white is less than seven, Iroas isn't a creature.
Creatures you control have menace. (They can't be blocked except by two or more creatures.)
Prevent all damage that would be dealt to attacking creatures you control.

cards.name: Keranos, God of Storms
cards.text:
Indestructible
As long as your devotion to blue and red is less than seven, Keranos isn't a creature.
Reveal the first card you draw on each of your turns. Whenever you reveal a land card this way, draw a card. Whenever you reveal a nonland card this way, Keranos deals 3 damage to target creature or player.

cards.name: Kruphix, God of Horizons
cards.text:
Indestructible
As long as your devotion to green and blue is less than seven, Kruphix isn't a creature.
You have no maximum hand size.
If unused mana would empty from your mana pool, that mana becomes colorless instead.

cards.name: Nyx Weaver
cards.text:
Reach
At the beginning of your upkeep, put the top two cards of your library into your graveyard.
{1}{B}{G}, Exile Nyx Weaver: Return target card from your graveyard to your hand.

cards.name: Pharika, God of Affliction
cards.text:
Indestructible
As long as your devotion to black and green is less than seven, Pharika isn't a creature.
{B}{G}: Exile target creature card from a graveyard. Its owner puts a 1/1 black and green Snake enchantment creature token with deathtouch onto the battlefield.

cards.flavor:
"Xenagos has fallen, and the world grows dark without him. What can ever fill that darkness but our rage?"
—Guruthes, disciple of Xenagos
cards.name: Revel of the Fallen God
cards.text: Put four 2/2 red and green Satyr creature tokens with haste onto the battlefield.

cards.name: Stormchaser Chimera
cards.text:
Flying
{2}{U}{R}: Scry 1, then reveal the top card of your library. Stormchaser Chimera gets +X/+0 until end of turn, where X is that card's converted mana cost. (To scry 1, look at the top card of your library, then you may put that card on the bottom of your library.)

cards.flavor: Coins of the Underworld are shaped from clay funerary masks.
cards.name: Underworld Coinsmith
cards.text:
Constellation — Whenever Underworld Coinsmith or another enchantment enters the battlefield under your control, you gain 1 life.
{W}{B}, Pay 1 life: Each opponent loses 1 life.

cards.flavor: From a distance the weapons look pristine, but in fact they are tarnished and dented, each as unique as the champion who carried it to battle.
cards.name: Armory of Iroas
cards.text:
Whenever equipped creature attacks, put a +1/+1 counter on it.
Equip {2}

cards.flavor: The greatest heroes are the first to stand, the first to take up arms, and the first to meet the enemy.
cards.name: Chariot of Victory
cards.text:
Equipped creature has first strike, trample, and haste.
Equip {1}

cards.flavor: In Akros, the penalty for running from battle is one night's stay in the Deserter's Quarters.
cards.name: Deserter's Quarters
cards.text:
You may choose not to untap Deserter's Quarters during your untap step.
{6}, {T}: Tap target creature. It doesn't untap during its controller's untap step for as long as Deserter's Quarters remains tapped.

cards.flavor: Blessed by the gods. Coveted by mortals. Beholden to neither.
cards.name: Gold-Forged Sentinel
cards.text: Flying

cards.flavor: Heroes act without thought of glory or reward. Accolades are a consequence, not a goal.
cards.name: Hall of Triumph
cards.text:
As Hall of Triumph enters the battlefield, choose a color.
Creatures you control of the chosen color get +1/+1.

cards.flavor: Five rivers encircle Theros, flowing with waters more ancient than the world itself.
cards.name: Mana Confluence
cards.text: {T}, Pay 1 life: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool.

cards.name: Temple of Epiphany
cards.text:
Temple of Epiphany enters the battlefield tapped.
When Temple of Epiphany enters the battlefield, scry 1. (Look at the top card of your library. You may put that card on the bottom of your library.)
{T}: Add {U} or {R} to your mana pool.

cards.name: Temple of Malady
cards.text:
Temple of Malady enters the battlefield tapped.
When Temple of Malady enters the battlefield, scry 1. (Look at the top card of your library. You may put that card on the bottom of your library.)
{T}: Add {B} or {G} to your mana pool.
